senses.de: A short description explaining the main points or idea of something
senses.ex: The teacher gave us an overview of what we will learn this semester.

Tips.title: Not Detailed
Tips.description: An overview is not meant to cover every detail but to present the general idea.
Tips.example: Before diving into each chapter, the professor provided an overview of the book's themes.

Tips.title: Starting Point
Tips.description: Use 'overview' at the beginning to introduce a broad topic before specifics.
Tips.example: The document starts with an overview of the company's history.

Tips.title: Verbal Summary
Tips.description: 'Overview' can be used when summarizing verbally, it signals a brief run-through of main points.
Tips.example: Let me give you an overview of the meeting's key outcomes.

Analysis.wordDefinition:
Analysis refers to the process of examining something in detail to understand its different parts and their relationships.

It involves breaking down something complex into smaller components and then studying each part separately. Analysis is useful when you want to understand the details of a particular subject, problem, or situation.

Analysis is about looking closely at something, while an overview is about getting a quick understanding of something.

Brief.wordDefinition:
Brief refers to a short statement or summary of information.

It is used when we need to provide information quickly and concisely. For example, if a teacher asks a student to give a brief explanation of a concept or if a manager asks an employee to give a brief update on a project.

Brief means to give a short and to-the-point summary, while overview means to give an explanation of the bigger picture.

Examination.wordDefinition:
Examination means to closely inspect, study or analyze something in detail.

It is often used to describe a general understanding of a situation or when giving a brief introduction to a topic. Examination is more in-depth and detailed, while overview is more general and brief.

Outline.wordDefinition:
An outline is a detailed plan that shows the main points of a topic or subject in the order they will be presented. It usually includes sub-points and specific details.

Outlines are often used to organize writing, speeches or other types of presentations that require a structured approach.

In essence, an outline is detailed and structured while an overview is more general and presented in a broader sense. Both are useful in different contexts, such as outlining a research paper or providing an overview of a company's operations in a business presentation.

Review.wordDefinition:
A review is a critical evaluation or analysis of something.

It is used to assess the strengths and weaknesses of a particular thing and provide feedback or recommendations. For example, a book review might discuss the writing style, character development, plot progression, and overall impact of the book.

An overview is a general summary while a review is a critical evaluation. An overview is more suitable for introducing a topic while a review is appropriate for analyzing it in detail.

Summary.wordDefinition:
A summary is a brief statement or account of the main points of something. It provides a condensed version of a longer text, often highlighting the most important information.

A summary is useful when you need to quickly recall the key points from something you have read or heard.

The main difference between the two is that an overview is a general overview while a summary is a more detailed, condensed version of something.

Survey.wordDefinition:
A survey is a detailed study or inspection of something, typically done to gather information or data.

A survey involves gathering information from a larger group of people or things, often through questions or observations.

For example, if a company wants to know what their customers think about their product, they may conduct a survey to collect feedback from a large sample of customers.

An overview is more appropriate when you want a brief understanding of something, while a survey is useful when you want a more in-depth understanding by gathering specific information.

Synopsis.wordDefinition:
Synopsis, on the other hand, is a more detailed summary of something. It provides a condensed version of the key events or ideas in a book, movie, or other work of literature.

A synopsis is useful if you want to understand the whole story without reading the entire work.

- A synopsis gives you a detailed summary of something in a condensed form.

quotes.Text: I think now that I'm in the autumn of my life, and I'm getting a chance of having an overview and looking at the shape of how things happen, when things happen, why things happen, I think it was fitting that I spent most of my early career doing mask work, because I just don't think I was that comfortable in my own skin.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Ron Perlman

quotes.Text: My process for determining which eras I'd write about was to just read history books that gave a really broad overview of Chinese history. And when I came across a historical figure or a historical incident that was especially interesting to me, ideas for characters and stories would surface.
quotes.Title: British Novelist
quotes.Name: Susan Barker

quotes.Text: When you get down to it, the way that the music affects you individually is the most important thing, and when you let things like the location of a band get in the way or have an effect on your overview, you're cheating yourself out of a really good time.

quotes.Text: My biggest role as director on the film is keeping a sense of the overview - how to cast the movie and shoot it in such a way that it will cut together. And how to design the style and tone.
